result.markdown:
::: {.question} **Net Proceeds in an SEO** Orion AutoTech executed a seasoned equity offering (SEO) of 16 million shares at $42.14 per share. Of these, 7.4 million were primary (new shares issued by the company) and 8.6 million were secondary (sold by existing investors). Assume the underwriter charges 3.5% of the gross proceeds as an underwriting fee which is shared proportionately between the primary and secondary shares. ::: {.question-block}
1. The amount of money raised by the company (in million USD) is:
✅ Net to issuer = (Primary Shares × Price) − Underwriter fee on primary = (7.4 × $42.14) − (3.5% × $311.84 million) = $311.84 million − $10.91 million = **$300.9 million**.
::: ::: {.question-block}
2. The amount of money raised by the VC (in million USD) is:
✅ Net to VCs = (Secondary Shares × Price) − Underwriter fee on secondary = (8.6 × $42.14) − (3.5% × $362.4 million) = $362.4 million − $12.68 million = **$349.7 million**.
::: ::: {.question-block}
3. The amount of money the underwriter will earn (in million USD) is:
✅ Fee = (Total Shares × Price) × Fee Rate = (16 × $42.14) × 3.5% = $674.24 million × 3.5% = **$23.6 million**.
::: :::
